net.sf.appia.management.jmx
Class GenericActuator

java.lang.Object
  net.sf.appia.management.jmx.GenericActuator

public class GenericActuator
extends java.lang.Object

This class defines a GenericActuator. This class is a wrapper to invoke JMX methods on Appia channels.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Nuno Carvalho

Constructor Detail

GenericActuator

public GenericActuator()
Method Detail

connect

public void connect(java.lang.String namingHost,
                    int namingPort,
                    java.lang.String channelName)
             throws AppiaManagementException
This method must be called before any invocations are made and it connects to an Appia process via JMX.

Parameters:
namingHost - the host where Appia is running.
namingPort - the JMX port inside the Appia process.
channelName - the Channel ID that we want to manage
Throws:
AppiaManagementException

getLocalMBean

public void getLocalMBean(java.lang.String managementMBeanID,
                          java.lang.String channelName)

invoke

public java.lang.Object invoke(java.lang.String action,
                               java.lang.Object[] params,
                               java.lang.String[] signature)
                        throws AppiaManagementException
Invokes a method inside an Appia Layer.

Parameters:
action - the method to invoke in the form layerID:methodName
params - the parameters to pass to the method we want to invoke
signature - the signature of the method.
Returns:
the object returned by the invoked method.
Throws:
AppiaManagementException

getAttribute

public java.lang.Object getAttribute(java.lang.String attribute)
                              throws AppiaManagementException
Gets the value of an attribute inside an Appia Layer.

Parameters:
attribute - the attribute name in the form layerID:attributeName
Returns:
the value of the attribute
Throws:
AppiaManagementException

setAttribute

public void setAttribute(javax.management.Attribute attribute)
                  throws AppiaManagementException
Sets a new value for a specified attribute in an Appia layer.

Parameters:
attribute - the attribute name and value that we want to set. The name must be in the form layerID:attributeName
Throws:
AppiaManagementException
